gaia::storage::FileInputStream Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A Stream way to read primitive data.

All read requests made by calling methods in this class are directly forwarded to the equivalent function of the underlying operating system.

The following example demonstrates how to use this FileInputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     gaia::core::Context* context =  new gaia::core::Context(this);
     gaia::base::String fileName("file.txt");
     // Read a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt.
     gaia::storage::FileInputStream* fis = context->openFileInput(fileName);

     // Check this file whether it is available or not.
     if (fis->available()) {
         gaia::base::ByteArray buffer(20);
         if (fis->read(buffer) > 0)
             // ...
     }

     fis->close();
 }

See the sample given above. It reads a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt by FileInputStream.
